challenge.description: Oxygen loss during high-temperature quenching at 800°C and 925°C.
challenge.impact: Oxygen loss alters the stoichiometry and structural integrity of the spinel phase, leading to the formation of an additional lithium-rich phase (Li2MnO3).

solution.description: Structural refinements were performed to understand the mechanism of oxygen loss and its impact on the spinel lattice.
solution.methodology: Neutron powder diffraction and Rietveld refinement techniques were used to analyze site occupancies and atomic displacement parameters.
solution.effectiveness: The solution provided detailed insights into the structural changes but did not prevent oxygen loss during quenching.

evidence.data: Neutron diffraction patterns showed increased atomic displacement parameters for oxygen and the presence of Li2MnO3 impurity phase.

context.material_properties: Spinel structure with mixed cation occupancy and oxygen vacancies.
context.application_relevance: Understanding oxygen loss is critical for optimizing the material's performance as a cathode in lithium-ion batteries.

challenge.description: Oxygen vacancies induced by low-temperature ammonia treatment at 200°C.
challenge.impact: Oxygen vacancies lead to a decrease in manganese oxidation state and structural changes, including increased atomic displacement parameters and altered stoichiometry.

solution.description: Refinement of structural models to account for oxygen vacancies and their effects on the spinel lattice.
solution.methodology: Neutron powder diffraction and Rietveld refinement were used to quantify oxygen vacancies and analyze structural changes.
solution.effectiveness: The solution confirmed the occurrence of oxygen vacancies but did not mitigate their formation during ammonia treatment.

evidence.data: Refined atomic occupations showed decreased oxygen occupancy and a reduction in average manganese valence from 3.75 to 3.63.

context.material_properties: Spinel structure with cubic symmetry and oxygen vacancies.
context.experimental_conditions: Ammonia gas treatment at 200°C for 3 hours.
context.application_relevance: Oxygen vacancies impact the electrochemical performance of the material in battery applications.

challenge.description: Poor agreement in structural refinement due to elongated nuclear densities near oxygen atom sites.
challenge.impact: Elongated nuclear densities suggest static disorder of oxygen atoms, complicating accurate structural modeling.

solution.description: Introduction of anisotropic atomic displacement parameters for oxygen atoms in the structural model.
solution.methodology: Difference Fourier maps and refinement of anisotropic displacement parameters were used to improve the model.
solution.effectiveness: The solution reduced reliability factors (R81 decreased from 17.0 to 8.48), improving the structural model's accuracy.

evidence.data: Fourier maps showed residual nuclear densities around oxygen positions, and refined anisotropic displacement parameters improved reliability factors.

context.material_properties: Spinel structure with Jahn-Teller distorted tetragonal symmetry.
context.experimental_conditions: Quenching from 925°C and subsequent neutron diffraction analysis.
context.application_relevance: Accurate structural modeling is essential for understanding material behavior and optimizing its use in energy storage applications.
